metadata.title: CVE-2016-1585 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In all versions of AppArmor mount rules are accidentally widened whencompiled.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1585` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apparmor - 4.0.0~alpha2-0ubuntu5
apparmor-notify - 4.0.0~alpha2-0ubuntu5
apparmor-profiles - 4.0.0~alpha2-0ubuntu5
apparmor-utils - 4.0.0~alpha2-0ubuntu5
dh-apparmor - 4.0.0~alpha2-0ubuntu5
libapache2-mod-apparmor - 4.0.0~alpha2-0ubuntu5
libapparmor1 - 4.0.0~alpha2-0ubuntu5
libpam-apparmor - 4.0.0~alpha2-0ubuntu5
python3-apparmor - 4.0.0~alpha2-0ubuntu5
python3-libapparmor - 4.0.0~alpha2-0ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apparmor package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.0~alpha2-0ubuntu5').
